peerCounsellor.name: Paraardha Goel
peerCounsellor.qualification: Pursuing MSc in Counselling and family therapy
peerCounsellor.about: I am a final year masters student of counselling and family therapy as well as early childhood education. I aspire to become an educational reforminist in coming years and also develop an intervention for improved mother-child stimulation for people in need.

peerCounsellor.name: Sahithi Mannar
peerCounsellor.about: I feel Mental health should be a topic that can be spoke on a coffee with friends and over a dinner with family .I'm a dancing psychologist who believes that the best message I can give to the world is my story.

peerCounsellor.name: Swetha Desiraju
peerCounsellor.about: Swetha Desiraju is a student of Clinical Psychology and a peer counsellor for FindHope. Her passion for mental health started when she was 18 years old. She has been in the field of mental health for 4 years now. She has also worked with children with developmental disorders. She is the Chairperson of a Suicide Prevention Awarenss Project called “Here With You”, initiated by Rotaract. She is also a LifeSkills trainer.

peerCounsellor.name: Riya Aggarwal
peerCounsellor.about: An optimistic ambivert person with qualities like empathy and communication skills

peerCounsellor.name: Jahnvi Kumar
peerCounsellor.qualification: Currently pursuing BA+ MA Clinical Psychology
peerCounsellor.about: A mental health enthusiast who believes in the power of words and their magical exchange, the free release and the absorption. Listening more, everyday.

peerCounsellor.name: Mokshita batra
peerCounsellor.about: I'm a mental health enthusiast  . An empathetic person with the zeal to help people recover from their mental health issues.  I have interned in a hospital and juvenile de-addiction centre.  I have been trained in giving  emotional aid and QPR gatekeeping.

peerCounsellor.name: Prerona Chakraborty
peerCounsellor.about: I am a student of applied psychology with an empathetic and prosocial attitude. Interested in providing aid to those going through stress,trauma, depression, adjustment issues,anxiety, relationship problems etc. Ability to analyse signature as well.

peerCounsellor.name: Prarthana Sagar
peerCounsellor.qualification: MA in applied psychology with specialization in counselling
about: "We can grow through what we go through"
Prarthana is driven by this philosophy. As a mental health worker she is passionate about fostering emotional well-being by lending an ear.

peerCounsellor.name: Jhanvi Kundra
about: I am a budding psychologist, hypnotherapist and art based therapist.

peerCounsellor.name: Kunjam Khurana
peerCounsellor.qualification: Pursuing 3rd year bsc h Psychology, advance diploma in counselling and guidance
about: I am a normal girl with normal dreams. With some set backs faced in my life I started teaching in jagriti and disha in my 11 th standard where is when I realised Psychology was the correct field for me. Since then the only rule in my life is to never stop but as life is its not always happy, its just like your heartbeat, it fluctuates up and down. But to all those who want a stable life; remember heartbeat is only stable when the person is dead. I remember I prepared for getting into lady shree ram college all my 12th standard, but even after securing a 98% my parents didn't wanted me to leave the city. That time I could have either left my hopes or go with the flow. Today I have been an active NSS group leader from past two years, a debater, a young entrepreneur, a national level painter, and pursuing Bsc h in Psychology, professional diploma in nutrition, advance diploma in counselling and guidance and diploma in NGO management. Still I am always looking for new opportunities and believe in rest not till you reach the motto of my school which I carry with pride.

peerCounsellor.name: Radhika Goel
peerCounsellor.qualification: MA (Applied) Psychology (pursuing)   Post Graduate Diploma in Guidance and Counselling (pursuing)
about: A positive psychology enthusiast who believes in the power of thoughts.

peerCounsellor.name: Shivangi Singh
peerCounsellor.qualification: B.A (hons.) Psychology final year, Advance diploma in counselling and guidance
about: A budding psychologist, always intrigued to learn new things and study behaviour. I am a firm believer that introspection and the will to revamp ourselves can change lives not just ours but also of people around us.My purpose in life is to see people say "Mai udna chahta hu dodna chahta hu girna bhi chahta hu bas rukna nahi chahta", I think the line captures the sentiment perfectly.

peerCounsellor.name: Sakshi Jain
peerCounsellor.qualification: Psychology honours final year student, Diploma in Counselling & Guidance
about: I am a simple girl with all those million dreams. However, thing that sets me apart from others is my listening skills, being there for people and be a constant support be it family or friends or anyone whom I can lend an empathetic ear to,  I am always enthusiastic about it !!

peerCounsellor.name: Prachi Pandey
about: I am a person who believes in her and follow the motto of embracing the journey of life.

peerCounsellor.name: Mithra K
peerCounsellor.languages: Tamil, English, Hindi. Can understand Kannada and to an extent converse.
about: I'm a post graduate who's aspiring to pursue Clinical Psychology full time. I strongly believe that mental health should be easily accessible as well as affordable. Keen on starting the right conversation about mental health and it's need. Believe that both quality and quantity are of need in today's mental sector. Queer friendly. Interested in understanding and creating a healthy platform for others to understand gender dynamics and sexuality in a better context.

peerCounsellor.name: SravyaNanda
about: Hey! This is sravya Nanda, Counselor in Training. I am passionate about creating safe , non-  judgmental spaces  where people can have honest and open conversation. I believe in nature, magical things and unicorns :)
interest: Mental health concerns and well being
